posts.cooked: When you play audio-messages, it should be possible to skip 5 seconds back/forth (e.g. if you didn‚Äôt understand something).

posts.name: link ‚ú¶
posts.cooked:
Felix:

And there should also be a toggle for playing audio-messages with double speed

It looks like that feature has already been requested in the Speeding up Voice Memo Clips topic. You can like () the first post there to show your support. I‚Äôll edit your post to only request the skipping feature in order to avoid duplication (edit: done). Thank you for your understanding.

posts.name: Fabian Rodriguez
posts.cooked:
AntennaPod has a nice implementation:

image1079√ó358 62.7 KB

I like the interface, but 10 seconds (and even more the 30 seconds) are way too long if you only misunderstood something and want a quick skip back / forward again. 5 seconds would be perfect, and if somebody wants more, this could be done with repeated use of the buttons.

posts.name: Felix
posts.cooked:
Skipping 5 seconds back/forth in audio-messages would be a great and very handy feature. And no other messenger has it yet, so it would be a standalone-feature for Signal.

I have an idea, how to make the GUI for this:
Too many buttons could be a usability-problem. But how about this idea; swiping left/right on the audio-message skips 5 seconds back/forth.

For exact positioning the user can still drag-and-hold the marker to drag it to another position in the message. But a simple swipe left/right could skip 5 seconds back/forth.

I think, that would be a good solution to keep a clear and easy-to-use interface, but also offering this handy feature.

I support this idea. It would not only be handy if you didn‚Äôt understood something and want to hear it again or if you want to skip less interesting parts of an audio-message, but it would also be very handy if you want a certain part of an older message again (e.g. with date, time and place of an appointment or something like that).

Therefore (and for some reasons more) it would be very useful to have such a feature.

FelixH:

I have an idea, how to make the GUI for this:
Too many buttons could be a usability-problem. But how about this idea; swiping left/right on the audio-message skips 5 seconds back/forth.

I think, swiping is not a good idea, because it maybe interfers with positioning the ‚Äúcursor‚Äù to a specific position on the time-line. But there is another ‚Äúgesture‚Äù that is already accepted for this function: e.g. in Youtube Mobile you can double-tap in the left / right half of the video to skip 5 seconds back / forward. This gesture could be transfered to Signal.

And maybe it‚Äôs also possible to add buttons for this. To have both, buttons as well as a gesture, for this feature would be perfect.
posts.edit_reason: A post was merged in by Herohtar

posts.name: Felix Westermann
posts.cooked:
I agree, that double-tapping (that is already known from some apps and webpages) is better than a left- or right-swipe.

But I don‚Äôt know, where to place the buttons for skipping back / forward. I think, Signal should remain by its solution to control audio-playback inside the message-bubble and not (like in Telegram) in a different control-field at top of the screen. But the available area inside a message-bubble is very limited. Besides the standards (play/pause and the progress-indicator) there is already the speed-button to control the playback-speed. The two more buttons for skipping 5 seconds back / forward have to be integrated there too. They have to be big enough for touch-use and they have to be far enough away from the adjacent buttons to not accidentally hitting another button.

If this is possible inside the limited space, this should be done. Does anybody know, if the available space is enough for that?

Felix_W:

If this is possible inside the limited space, this should be done.

Even my old iPhone with a 4.7-inch-screen (all current phones have bigger screens) has enough room for it. So this should be no problem‚Ä¶

posts.name: Felix Westermann
posts.cooked:
By the way:
video-playback in Signal should get the same features‚Ä¶

posts.name: Jasper Buntglas
posts.cooked: I wanted to suggest the same and found that idea here. My idea was only about skipping back a few seconds, if you didn‚Äôt understand anything, but to have also a function for skipping forward a fes seconds, would be nice too.

That would be very useful for those of us, who often receive longer audio-messages.

Separate buttons would be great, but if this is not possible or the developers don‚Äôt want to make the GUI too crowded, it could be done in a similar way like the mobile GUI of YouTube. Double-tap in the right half of the audio-message to skip 5 secs forward and double-tap in the left half to skip 5 secs back.

This gesture is known from Youtube and others, so it is not new, yet familiar to many users. Those users who don‚Äôt need it, don‚Äôt see it and are not bothered with it. But those who want it, have a simple-to-use and easy-to-remember gesture for this.

Double-tap in the right half of the audio-message to skip 5 secs forward and double-tap in the left half to skip 5 secs back.

I think, it should be considered, if this is an ‚Äúexpert-feature‚Äù that only a few people need, or if this is a feature that should be easy to use for all users. In the first case, the suggestion with the double-tap in the left or right half of the message is very suitable, because it is known from Youtube and others. But if this is a feature, that is useful to many users, it should not be hidden, but visible to everybody, e.g. by dedicated buttons, similar like the button for playback-speed.

@CarstenW I would prefer to have both: GUI-elements for having a better discoverability of this feature. (And I think, this feature is useful for many people, not only pro-users.)

But also a double-tap-gesture for faster and easier access of pros.

If only one of them is implemented, I would prefer the first one (GUI-elements).
